title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Tuesday 14 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: barrow island young film-makers head for london red carpet .
researcher looks into domestic abuse of men .
yew tree given voice of brian blessed .

documents.title: carlisle united 0-0 luton town
text: carlisle united 0-0 luton town

documents.title: through the day : bbc cumbria live
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports and a regular weather forecast , interspersed with other things that catch our eye around the county , for today .
a reminder :
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow to do it all again .
as always , if you have a photograph you 'd like to share or you have news you think we should know , you can .
email us , .
tweet us .
or get in touch .
through our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: do not approach this man wanted by police
text: police are trying to trace mark blamire , from cleator moor , who 's being recalled to prison after breaching his release conditions .
he 's said to be 5ft 11in tall , and of medium build.. police say he should not be approached .

documents.title: 'prolific ' thief sentenced for handling burglary haul
text: a criminal described as a `` prolific shoplifter '' was caught with cash and belongings in a burglary the previous night .
simon highmore , 27 , from priory road in carlisle , admitted handling stolen goods , although it was stressed he 'd not been responsible for the break-in , the city 's crown court heard .
judge tony lancaster was told highmore had a record of 74 offences but had recently kicked a drug addiction .
the judge suspended a four month prison sentence for a year , and ordered highmore to cpmplete 200 hours of unpaid work and a rehabilitation requirement .

documents.title: heart attack casualty revived at roadside
text: a man who collapsed with a cardiac arrest at the side of a windermere road was saved by an ambulance crew with cpr before being flown to hospital in carlisle .
the medical crew on the great north air ambulance put the man into an induced coma and he was said to be seriously ill but stable on arrival .

documents.title: bt says sorry to 'crossed wires ' customers
text: bt engineers have apologised to customers in a lake district valley , after some of their wires were crossed while a fault was being repaired .
the overhead cable into kentmere was found to be faulty while a new customer was being reconnected , and a spokeswoman said the wires were crossed while a new line was installed .
`` we 've been putting these lines right and hope to have all of them working again by the end of the week .
we apologise for the inconvenience this has caused . ''
she added that around 18 customers were still affected this afternoon .

documents.title: penrith floods charity 'close to folding '
text: a cumbrian charity set up to help flood victims says it 's on the verge of closing if it ca n't find more funding .
hundreds of people were helped with furniture and home goods by the community emergency response team , which was previously known as eden flood volunteers .
it 's now trying to help people in other crises like homelessness or domestic violence , but sue dust from the charity says its existing funding will run out in april .

documents.title: male abuse victims 'do n't speak up '
text: earlier today we reported on a research project at the university of cumbria into male victims of domestic abuse .
it 's sparked a discussion on bbc radio cumbria 's twitter feed .
men who are or have been the victims of domestic abuse are being asked to contribute to research by a lecturer at the university of cumbria
there is n't enough awareness of domestic abuse towards men !
men who are or have been the victims of domestic abuse are being asked to contribute to research by a lecturer at the university of cumbria
the numbers will always be skewed because most men would never speak up .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : a fine dry night
text: it should be a fine evening and dry night with long clear spells and light southwest winds .
there 'll be a minimum temperature of 5c ( 41f ) .
you can find the latest weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your spring lambs check out westie jock
text: spring is now sufficiently sprung to have lambs in the lake district and elizabeth halsall introduced these to her westie , jock , at keswick .
our thanks to elizabeth for sending it in ; .
if you have a photograph you 'd like to share or you have news you think we should know , you can .
email us , .
tweet us .
or get in touch .
through our facebook page .

documents.title: national park 'relies on commercial income '
text: missing commercial targets could cost the lake district national park hundreds of thousands of pounds , according to this year 's budget report .

the authority 's government grants have been steadily reduced in recent years , and the papers going before a meeting next week says the £ 11m a year spending plans rely on income from sources such as car parks and the brockhole visitor centre for £ 4.3m a year .
the park will be steadily reducing its spending from around £ 11.5m this year to £ 10.1m in 2020 .

documents.title: farmers get more time to take over pumping schemes
text: landowners have been given more time before they have to take over major flood prevention schemes in two parts of cumbria .

the environment agency is stopping funding drainage of agricultural land , which means farmers in the lyth valley in south cumbria , and the waver and wampool valleys in north cumbria , have to take over the costs of pumps , dykes and ditches or see their land flooded for months in the winter .
originally the landowners should have taken over the drainage systems in 2015 , but government officials now say new legislation may be needed to set up what are called internal drainage boards .
to allow time for this , successive delays have been announced and the agency has now confirmed the lyth scheme wo n't be handed over until 2020 and the waver and wampool drainage in 2018 .

documents.title: cumbrian rescue volunteers ' sadness after helicopter crash
text: the world of search and rescue is a small one and cumbrian volunteers have been shocked .
by a crash involving an irish coastguard helicopter .
the pilot of the helicopter died following the crash off the coast of mayo .
the aircraft lost contact at about 01:00 local time as it was coming in to refuel during a rescue operation .
a search is continuing for the pilot 's three colleagues who are still missing .
the thoughts of everyone at patterdale mrt are with a fellow rescuers in ireland and their friends and families .
tragic news from ireland .
the thoughts and prayers of our whole team are with the family , friends and colleagues of the # rescue116 crew .

documents.title: curle demands better as carlisle slide again
text: carlisle united manager keith curle says he `` will not accept '' another performance like saturday 's 3-0 defeat against cambridge , when carlisle host promotion-rivals luton tonight .
united dropped to fifth in league two following their fourth defeat on the trot at the weekend .
author: BBC Radio Cumbria Sport

documents.title: police probe fire in historic square
text: police say they 're treating a car fire in the centre of cartmel as arson .
emergency services were called to the square at about 19:00 on sunday , and firefighters say the vehicle was well alight .
police say they 'd like to hear from anyone who has information on the fire .

documents.title: cumbria researcher seeks 'abused men ' for study
text: men , who are , or have been , the victims of domestic abuse , are being asked to contribute to research by a lecturer at the university of cumbria .
dr liz bates is starting her research this week ; she says that while .
some statistics suggest one in three victims of domestic abuse are men , their experiences are `` not as well understood '' .
her project includes a n online questionnaire that men can fill in anonymously .

documents.title: darts row man sentenced for injuring player 's back
text: a boat skipper from workington was so annoyed at being knocked out of a darts competition that he attacked another player , breaking a bone in his back .
carlisle crown court heard today that ryan bracken , 22 , from wesley street , could be seen on cctv punching a bystander and then attacking mathew smith in the town 's royal george pub .
mr smith was crushed against a wall , suffering a broken vertebra that left the bricklayer in agony and off work for weeks .
judge peter davies suspended a 12-month prison term for two years , ordering bracken to complete 300 hours unpaid work and pay mr smith £ 2,000 in compensation .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : sunny , breezy and mild
text: it 'll be a dry afternoon with sunny spells , fresh westerly winds and a maximum temperature of 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find the weather latest forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hello , yew - the cumbrian tree that sounds uncannily like brian blessed
text: it was the job the famous actor brian blesssed said he `` could n't refuse '' .
brian 's voice has been used by the woodland trust to educate visitors to great knott wood , near ulverston , about ancient woodlands .
what he has to say can be heard by anyone who visits the yew tree ( but you can get a preview by clicking on the link above ) .

documents.title: windermere 'accident ' was medical incident , police say
text: police now say the incident which closed the a591 at windermere this morning was not an accident , but that the road was closed to allow an air ambulance to land after a man collapsed by the road .
the man was flown to the cumberland infirmary at carlisle and the road has now been reopened .

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : cloud lifting
text: you can find the daily report from the lake district rangers here .

documents.title: pedestrian in windermere accident
text: police say the accident which has closed the a591 in windermere at cook 's house corner , involves a pedestrian .
an air ambulance is at the scene .

documents.title: police say missing 19-year-old may be in barrow
text: a 19-year-old woman missing from her home in skelmersdale may be in barrow , lancashire police say .
katie heron was last seen at her home last wednesday , and pc helen smith said her family was becoming increasingly worried .

documents.title: council targets 35 non-taxpayers
text: allerdale council has announced that it 's targeting 35 persistent non-payers of council tax .
officials say the householders , some of whom owe up to £ 9,000 , should contact the authority as soon as possible to arrange a repayment plan or seek advice on help to pay .
but they also say the courts and bailiffs could be used to bring the money in .

documents.title: barrow island 's young movie-makers head for london red carpet
text: it 's a big day for youngsters from barrow island , as they head for the finals of a film-making competition at the leicester square odeon in london .
they made an animated film called the lost station about the former shipyard railway station that used to be near their school .
now there 's only rough grassland where trains used to steam to and fro carrying workers at the yard .
we hope to tell you later how they got on .
and we 're off !
# londonadventure @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
good luck from all @ twitterid
good luck & have a fantastic time !
good luck x x

documents.title: business chief : not having a cumbria mayor has cost us millions
text: cumbria 's decision to reject a local government shake-up and an elected mayor have cost the county millions of pounds , according to an organisation that represents local businesses .
the comments come as companies are being invited to apply for money from a new £ 400m northern powerhouse investment fund .
the cumbria local enterprise partnership is holding an event near penrith this morning to explain more .
but , the chief executive of the cumbria chamber of commerce , rob johnston , says the partnership would have more money to give out - if councils had agreed to devolution
had we had a devolved administration with an elected mayor , i guess we could have been seeing more in the region of £ 250m or £ 300m

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : mild with cloud clearing
text: it 'll be a mild start , mostly with some drizzle at first this morning , but it should clear into a dry day .
there 'll be fresh westerly winds and a maximum temperature of 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find the latest weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather
